WorkItem.ClosedComment: This is fixed with a recent checkin, should be in the next release.
WorkItem.Description:
The "Announcing TypeScript 0.8.3.0" article on the TypeScript Blog page (release notes) claimed that:

"The Visual Studio support for source level debugging of TypeScript no longer requires that the files being debugged are part of the current project".

In two different projects I have tried to include only the *.ts files in the VS project file (exclude the compiled *.js/*.map files). I compile using the AMD option and generate source map files.

When excluding *.js/*.map files from the project files, the result is that the debugger never hits a breakpoint in the imported (AMD) modules. It hits breakpoints of the scripts that were not imported using AMD though.

Really hoping for this to get fixed for Version 0.9.0.0, I really would appreciate to keep only the source code (*.ts files) in the source control. All the *.js/*.map files really pollutes the change log.
WorkItem.Summary: Debugging with AMD without *.js/*.map files as part of VS project file

Comments.Message:
Could you attach a project where you're seeing this behavior and then re-activate this bug? AMD shouldn't have been affecting whether this feature worked correctly.
